column20: As the Phenopackets structure entails nested fields, we count only the most granular, innermost fields included in each domain. For example, phenopacket.Individual.vital_status details whether an individual is alive. This field is of type VitalStatus, which is an object that further holds status, time_of_death, cause_of_death, and survival_time_in_days. In counting the fields that are mappable, we count only the innermost level (e.g. phenopacket.Individual.vital_status.time_of_death) to avoid double counting of fields and their subfields. We restrict our discussion of field mapping to fields within the top-level entities that are mappable, as trivially any domain that is unmapped will confer unmapped fields within that domain.
